channel.title: Devops on epantzar - webdeveloper
channel.description: Recent content in Devops on epantzar - webdeveloper

item.title: Finally got Jekyll to work
item.description:
Finally got Jekyll to work

It all started when I read my own post on my former WordPress-site about Grunt, that on the site the article was on, there was also a post about getting into Jekyll and later on getting into Github Pages. Since I'm a big fan of both github and really into these static site generators I decided to have a go.

It begins

I’m quite new to grunt and task-running things through Javascript, but I’m very fond of it, and want to use it on everything.

Github gogo

After I got my github.io domain working, I decided to drop the old site and the hosting that is hosted on. Transferring files over FTP is so not me (anymore).

I really like to redesign things whilst producing content in the form of blogposts; So the idea of having it directly on Github surely wasn’t hard to start working towards.

item.title: Get grunting
item.description:
Get Grunting

Have previously fought with getting Grunt working. Now around Christmas i found a blogg linking to this article: Grunt is not weird and hard.

Wuth some trial and errors with various node stuff and managing and installing Sass and compass with ease, getting grunt with the artcile previously mentioned was a breeze.

So going from just getting Sass on new and already running projects, I now Grutify them. Getting the Compass and Sass with the JS concatinations and JSHints and Uglift.

The greatest feeling is when you for the first time can separeate your JS into separate files..!!

https://github.com/erikpantzar/gruntgogo

The youtube video here.

The next big GRUNT thing is to get CasperJs and PhantomJS to give me breakpoint screenshots automaticly.. ! (Low priority)
